summary: This bill, the United States Automobile Consumer Assistance and Relief Act (USA CAR Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a tax deduction for qualified automobile interest. This deduction applies to interest paid on loans for cars manufactured in the United States, effective for debts incurred after the date of enactment. The bill defines “qualified automobile interest” and specifies the criteria for a “qualified automobile,” which includes cars made by manufacturers whose final assembly occurs in the U.S.
